New Records: The Thunder extended their winning streak to 15 games with the victory.
Key Match Events: The Thunder trailed 35-32 at the end of the first quarter but pulled away in the second half.
A late third-quarter run was jumpstarted by a corner triple from Lu Dort, followed by a layup from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.
The Thunder outscored the Celtics in the fourth quarter, taking the lead early and maintaining it until the end.
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics jumped out to an early lead with Jaylen Brown scoring 21 points in the first half.
Both teams' defenses were highlighted as key factors in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander finished with 33 points, 11 rebounds, and six assists, showing his star performance.
The Thunder's defensive efforts and perimeter shooting improvements were noted as crucial to their victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a defensive battle, with both teams struggling from the perimeter.
The Thunder's ability to close the gap in the third quarter and take the lead in the fourth was pivotal.
